resources.string: Rhythm Music Widget - Control Playback with responsive layouts supporting 2x1 to 5x5 grid sizes
Rhythm Music - Control Playback with 9 responsive layouts, Material 3 design, and real-time state updates
Changes will be applied to all active widgets on your home screen. Long-press the widget to resize it and see different layouts.
Apply blur effect to widget background
Automatically update widget when song changes
Rhythm supports multiple widget sizes from 2x1 to 5x5
Both legacy and modern Glance widgets are available
Tap the widget to open the app, buttons control playback
Long-press and resize for different layouts
Use app\'s custom notification style instead of system media notification
Let the media player handle shuffle (recommended: OFF for manual shuffle)
Automatically add related songs to queue when playing
Clear the current queue when playing a new song directly
Save repeat mode (Off/All/One) between app restarts
Save shuffle on/off state between app restarts
Stop music when the app is closed from recent apps
Import from JSON, M3U, or PLS files
Create your first playlist to get started
Automatically create Recently Added and Most Played playlists
This will permanently delete %1$d empty playlist%2$s. This action cannot be undone.
Are you sure you want to delete \"%1$s\"? This action cannot be undone.
Hide specific songs and folders from your library
Only show songs from selected folders
Blacklist mode hides specific songs and folders from your library
Whitelist mode only shows songs from selected folders
Use folder management to organize your music collection
Enter your Spotify API credentials to enable track search and Canvas videos.
You are currently using the app\'s default Spotify keys. For full functionality and to avoid rate limits, please input your own Client ID and Secret.

To get your Spotify API credentials:
‚Ä¢ Go to developer.spotify.com
‚Ä¢ Create a new app
‚Ä¢ Copy the Client ID and Client Secret
A modern, feature-rich music player for Android
Built with modern Android technologies and Material Design 3
Special thanks to our amazing community members who have contributed to making Rhythm better through testing, feedback, suggestions, and collaboration.
Contribute to Rhythm through testing, feedback, or code contributions and join our amazing community!
Add some albums to your library to see featured content
Add some music to your library to see your artists
New albums will appear here as they\'re added to your library
Albums you add to your library will appear here

Continue where you left off with \"%1$s\"
Ready to discover your next favorite song?
Listen to some music to get personalized recommendations
Start listening to see your recently played songs here
Add some music to see your artists here
Check storage permissions if files don\'t appear
To browse your music files and explore your device\'s storage, Rhythm needs permission to access your files and media.
This allows access only to audio files and folders containing music.
Adjust the speed of audio playback.
Your search history will appear here
Songs you play will appear here
Genre suggestions will appear here once detected
No genres detected in your library
Automatic update checking is disabled. You can still check manually.
App updates have been disabled in settings
Using efficient HTTP checks to detect updates while minimizing GitHub API calls. You\'ll get instant notifications when new versions are released.
Choose which update channel to follow:
Personalize every aspect of your listening experience with powerful features and complete privacy. Play your music offline, ad-free, with full control.
On newer Android versions, you\'ll see multiple permission requests. Please grant access to audio files and notifications for the best experience.
Keep your playlists, settings, and preferences safe with automatic backups. Restore everything when switching devices or after reinstalling - never lose your music collection.
Create backups or restore from existing backup files
You can manually create backups anytime in Settings > Backup & Restore
All settings, playlists, themes, and library customization
Restore from files or clipboard with one tap
Backups stored locally on your device for privacy
Customize your audio experience with haptic feedback, default screen, volume controls, queue behavior, shuffle settings, lyrics display, and equalizer settings.
API: Online lyrics ‚Ä¢ Embedded: Metadata lyrics ‚Ä¢ Local: .lrc files
Equalizer: Fine-tune audio frequencies in Settings > Equalizer
Sleep Timer: Auto-stop playback after set time (access from Now Playing screen)
Customize how your albums, artists, and songs are displayed. Choose your preferred layout, sorting order, and tab arrangement.
Customize tab order in Library for quick access to your favorites
Create and manage playlists directly from the Library screen
Advanced display and sorting options available in Settings > Theme Customization
Default playlists (Recently Added, Most Played) can be toggled in Settings > Playlists
Personalize Rhythm\'s appearance to match your style. Choose your system theme, font, or Material You dynamic colors (Android 12+).
Custom color schemes, album art colors, and fonts
Custom color schemes and album art color extraction
Advanced theme options available in Settings > Theme Customization
Custom color schemes, album art colors, and fonts
Control which audio files appear in your library. Use Blacklist mode to hide unwanted files (ringtones, notifications), or Whitelist mode to only show specific music folders.
Choose Blacklist or Whitelist mode ‚Ä¢ Current: %1$s
Blacklist Mode: Hide specific songs and folders (ringtones, notifications)
Whitelist Mode: Show only songs from selected folders
Configure scanning in Settings > Media Scan
Manage cache size and storage in Settings > Cache Management
Rhythm is ready to play! Your music library is being scanned in the background. Here\'s what\'s configured:
Browse your songs, albums, and artists
All settings can be changed anytime in Settings
All necessary permissions have been granted. You are ready to proceed!
To grant the required permissions, please navigate to the app settings on your device.
Rhythm requires certain permissions to function correctly. Please grant them to continue.
To fully utilize Rhythm\'s features, we need your permission to access certain device capabilities.
Read your local music files and display them in the app
Connect to Bluetooth speakers, headphones, and audio devices
Show playback controls and music information in notifications
Enable subtle vibrations on interactions for a more tactile experience.
Choose which screen opens when you launch Rhythm
Allow your device\'s physical volume buttons to control Rhythm\'s playback volume.
Automatically create a contextual queue from the album/artist when playing a song.
Replace the entire queue when playing a new song instead of adding to it.
Keep your repeat mode setting across app restarts.
Keep your shuffle on/off state across app restarts.
Let the media player handle shuffle (recommended: OFF for manual shuffle).
Display synchronized lyrics when available for your favorite songs.
Choose which lyrics source to try first (with automatic fallback to others)
Reorder Songs, Playlists, Albums, Artists, and Explorer tabs
Automatically switch between light and dark themes based on your device\'s system settings.
Manually enable or disable dark mode for the application.
Apply colors extracted from your device\'s wallpaper for a cohesive look.
Get the latest features, improvements, and bug fixes automatically from GitHub. Choose between Stable releases (recommended) or Beta builds for early access to new features. No Google Play required.
Allow the app to check for and download updates
Check for updates from Rhythm\'s GitHub repo automatically
Get notified when new versions are available
Use efficient checks to save GitHub API calls
How often to check for updates
Your music library organization preferences are set
Your custom theme and appearance settings are ready
Customize your theme with colors, fonts, and festive effects
Enable haptic feedback for tactile responses
Use media scan to hide unwanted files from your library
Quick access to your music collection
Set the maximum size for cached data
Automatically clear cached data when app closes
Choose where to look for Lyrics
Embedded lyrics are extracted from ID3v2 USLT tags in your audio files. For best results, use properly tagged MP3/FLAC files.
Album Art colors adapt dynamically to your music
Material You uses system wallpaper colors (Android 12+)
Import custom fonts to personalize typography
Choose where to load fonts from
Safeguard your personalized settings, playlists, and preferences. Create backups manually or enable automatic weekly backups for peace of mind.
Choose where to save your backup file
All settings, playlists, themes, and library customization
Restore from files or clipboard with one tap
Backups stored locally on your device for privacy
Blocked songs and folders won\'t appear in search results, recommendations, or auto-play queues
All your songs are available for playback

Built with amazing open source projects
All libraries permit use, reproduction, and distribution with proper attribution
Choose which source to check first for lyrics
Sync adjustment only works with time-synced lyrics (LRC format). Use Reset to fetch synced lyrics if available.

Enter lyrics here‚Ä¶

You can use LRC format:
[00:12.00] Line one
[00:17.00] Line two
Rhythm needs permission to modify this audio file\'s metadata. You may see a system dialog asking for access - please allow it to save your changes.
Create your first playlist to add songs
Manage cached data including images, temporary files, and other app data.
You are currently using the beta release of Rhythm. This version is still in development and may contain bugs, incomplete features, or unexpected behavior.
Enable the equalizer to customize your audio experience.
Color schemes are only available when using Custom color source.
Switch to Custom in the Color Source setting to access predefined schemes.
Custom colors are only available when using Custom color source.
Switch to Custom in the Color Source setting to create your own colors.
System fonts are only available when using System font source.
Switch to System in the Font Source setting to choose from available fonts.
